page.title: 07MEDICAL CARE IN CARBOST.
page.content: For our village and the surrounding areas,we have one doctor and two district nurses.One of the nurses is also the health visitor to our school.The doctor has a surgery next to his house at Trien,which is about 2 miles from the village.Consulting hours for the surgery are from 9.30 a.m. to 11.30 a.m.every weekday,except Thursday.We are fortunate because an appointment does not need to be made and if the patient is too unwell to go to the surgery,the doctor will visit the home. The nearest hospital is in Portree,16 miles away.Sometimes a patient may go to Broadfoard Hospital,26 miles away.If the illness cannot be dealt with on the island, a mainland hospital,perhaps 200 miles away might be necessary.
